column4: I'm having big issues with my video drive and compiz and awn, if there's anyone who feel's they're smart enough to tackle this one by all means, here's a summary of what's happened http://www.planetblur.org/hosted/awnforum/index.php?shard=forum&action=g_reply&ID=2012&page=1&isLive=true
are you having trouble getting your nvidia card to work
Ive had it working for a while until I tried to get awn working in kde, then the glx driver started taking over
I don't want the glx driver anymore, how do i get the nvidia one to work now?
I was told by people that if im using the glx driver to not go and uninstall it while your still using it, but i can't seem to switch to the nvidia one anyway
drop to the root recovery shell
ok then what do i do?
start ubuntu in recovery mode, uninstall it, then reinstall it
why do it in recovery as opposed to normally here in synaptic?
because in recovery mode you will be in text mode so you won't be running the driver
hmmm Im not that good with command line stuff
I wouldn't know what to enter
is there a way that I can do it in the gui?
